captions.text:
Slippery winter roads or hills
can pose a difficult challenge-
-for trucks with heavy trailers.

Even for the most skilled drivers
there's a risk

the trailer becomes unbalanced
and spins forward.
The so called jackknifing phenomenon,

for which Volvo Trucks
now has a solution,

can involve great risk
not only for the truck's driver-
-but also for oncoming traffic.

Johan Sundberg
at Sundberg's Haulage Company

drives heavily loaded rigs
on narrow forest roads.

He has experienced
the problem firsthand.

It happens on and off.
It's a very scary feeling.

It feels like being on a roller
coaster. You have no control.

Jackknifing is
a very dangerous situation.

There can be many consequences,
such as losing control of the vehicle

or going down the wrong
side of the road, personal injuries,

damaged vehicles
or even fatal accidents.

The problem is that the situation
is so difficult to control.

Jackknife is a phenomenon that occurs
between truck and trailer.

It's a nasty phenomenon
where the trailer,

when braking, pushes ahead
and comes up alongside the truck.
To prevent the risk of jackknifing

Volvo Trucks has developed a new type
of brake system: the stretch brake.

Stretch brake is a system
that automatically brakes the trailer
when the driver has activated it.

The system works so that
when the driver throttles down

it automatically
pulse brakes the trailer,

which keeps truck and trailer
straight and you avoid jackknifing.

Stretch brake
is something that will give

the driver
a feeling of more security.

That he knows what he's doing and can
control the vehicle in a good way.

title: Volvo Trucks - Increased safety on slippery roads with Volvo Trucks' Stretch Brake

comments.text:
i dont have any argument regarding volvo trucks- continuously Volvo truck 
segment is showing the promise to develop. truck segment is getting no time 
to adopt one particular technological advancement, i.e. too rapid 
improvement. but I am really sorry to say the bus sector seems sluggish. 
for instance, see the advent of scania in India has clearly decreased the 
new Volvo bus release. surprisingly Volvo bus india is apparently showing 
no promising response even in this fierce aggression of Scania. this would 
definitely be a sad story if a pioneer like volvo looses its grip to the 
newcomer within a very few days. .............﻿
